page.title: 01PORT DINORWIC
page.content: The focus is the compact village of Port Dinorwic on the Menai Strait midway along the Bangor-Caernarvon road. The dock that used to ship slate from the Llanberis quarry is now a yatch marina, a development encouraging associated enterprises. Except for housing near this marina, a steep inland slope has discouraged other than infill development. Above the slop the land levels to what geologists call the Menaian Platform, a widespread feature at an average altitude around 100m, varying in width in this area from 2 to 5 km, which terminates inland against the slopes of the Snowdonion foothills. A complex of freely drained gravelly soils with some poor drained depressions between glacial sand and gravel hummocks supports grasssland agriculture, with some rough grazing and deciduous,
